text: Draft at the Charleston Taproom, served in one of their branded mason jar-style glasses. Pours a hazy gold with a small white head that settles into a ring. Explosive citrusy and stone fruit hops, with florals, pine, grass, and a pale malt backbone. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and a bitter, fruity mouthfeel. Really nice and refreshing and impressive. Drinks below 6.8% ABV. I could drink a ton of these.

Born Again Yesterday has a medium, white head, a mostly clear, golden appearance, with some powdery sediment, and a bit of glass lacing. The aroma is of a bit of dankness and some resin, and the flavor is of balanced, bready and resiny quality, with that hard-to-pin-down Lagunitas house style. Mouthfeel is medium, and Born Again Yesterday finishes drying and nice. RJT

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours a cloudy golden with a white head and lacing. The aroma is citrus and strong hops. The taste is dank hops and grapefruit. This is really tasty. It tastes really fresh. Theres lots of bitterness. Its got some prickly carbonation going on. This is really enjoyable.

12oz bottle in a shaker. Pours hazy golden/amber with a white head. Aroma of floral and lightly citrusy hops, some pale malts, and, some dough. Flavor the same. Average texture. A pretty good pale but nothing special.

Sample at Local Cantina Grandview during the Taco Tuesday & Speaking Suds with Lagunitas event on 05/16/2017. Hazy bright orange color with a medium white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Stringy lacing. Aroma of piney hops, citrus and malt. Medium body with flavors of dank hops, grapefruit and malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a piney hop and citrus aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 5/5/2017. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy golden amber color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and rocky off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around the glass. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of huge grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, guava, mango, melon, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pepper, pine, light honey, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of citrus/tropical/fruity/earthy hops and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, guava, mango, melon, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pepper, pine, light honey, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/citrus peel/grassy/spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, guava, mango, melon, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, pepper, pine, bread, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/fruity/earthy hops and moderate pale malt flavors; with an awesome malt/bitterness balance, and zero astringent hop flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, bready/grainy, and sticky/resinous balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Zero warming alcohol for 7%. Overall this is a world class IPA! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/fruity/earthy hops and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink; with the balanced bitter/drying finish. Super vibrant, dank, and juicy on hops; with a nice malt backbone that is never sweet. An insanely amazing offering. Just as impressive as the regular Born Yesterday all around.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a thin white head. Strong aroma of juicy citrus and some pine. Medium bitter taste of citrus rind. Fairly smooth finish with lingering flavors. Its not as harsh or bitter as some similar style beers. Pretty enjoyable. Better than last years version.

Hoppy. An UnFiltered Born Again Pale Ale for all the wet hop lovers! We’ve discovered that the Lagunitas brewers are part time alchemists... they’ve figured out how to keep wet hops wet all freakin’ year long! The next beer in our 2016 #OneHitter Series is this Born Again Yesterday Pale Ale, which features a delicious concoction of wet hops, reborn and unfiltered into our Born Yesterday Pale Ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Last beer in my husband's flight at the shep. As the saying goes, he saved the best for last. That saying might not initially have been about craft beer flights but it should be. Amazing aroma and taste, very grainy and typical Lagunitas beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy orange-gold with white head. A citrus hop and tropical fruit aroma. A tropical fruit taste with citrus hops, pine and malts. A lingering bitter hop and light malt aftertaste.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy medium gold color topped by a small frothy white head. Amazingly fragrant spicy tropical fruit hop nose. First sip is tart lemony malt balanced by bittersweet hops. Mango, melon, tangerine, pine needles and dank citrus. Warming alcohol in finish. Chewy aftertaste. Outstanding!

Thanks Ryan for the bottle! Poured into a snifters showing moderately filtered dark apricot with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of citric orange and pineapple. 

The palate is well carbonated and light bodied. Flavors of orange and pineapple with a citric edge. Bready malts on the mid-palate with a moderate bitterness on the finish.

Citrusy hop-bomb.
Big head honey colored deliciousness 
Good stuff 

May 2017: Purchased a 12-pack at Costco for $15.99


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This one is an interesting slightly atypical offering from Lagunitas. It has a nice tropical smell, very floral and fruity. It pours a bright, almost neon hazy golden yellow. The taste is hoppy, fruity, tropical, but with some funk that comes around and keeps it interesting. Its good! Good for watching a couple minutes of the movie Joysticks until there is nudity then switching to something else.
12oz bottle from ck1, thanks! Pale golden orange pour. Big fruity hoppy nose. Tangy tropical fruit hoppy taste. Juicy! Finishes juicy sweeter than bittersweet. This is quite good! 16

bottle shared poured a semi cloudy yellow with white head. the nose is a mild malt base with tons of citrus hops almost overpowering but yet you cant stop inhaling. the flavor was spot on mild malt and a hop base that is just amazing. full flavored citrus hops rolling all over the place. very well balance and delicious.

Hops grab you and give you a good shake!
Just smelling the aroma is a delight 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blind tasted with 5 other "hazy" IPAs. The beers were: 1. Lagunitas Born Again Yesterday, 2. Begyle / Galaway Bay Goodbye Blue Monday, 3. The Fermentorium Juice Packets, 4. Oso Hop Debacle, 5. Transient Honeystone , 6. Transient / 18th Street Zero Discipline . Rater 1 rated the beers: 564132, Rater 2: 541623, Rater 3: 541623, Rater 4 (ME): 45 TIE 16 23 TIE, Rater 5: 56432, Rater 6: 156423.


355ml bottle. Lightly hazed golden pour. Aroma is dank orange/grapefruit juice. Hint of passionfruit. Flavor is dank tropical fruit juice and herbs.


Post tasting thoughts:

This is a slugger. Very tank and very tropical. One of the last great lagunitas products.

Luminous gold color with a little haze in there. A bit of a soapy white head to cap it off. VERY dank, fresh wholesome citrus and herbaceous hop aromatics. Starts with invitingly juicy orange juice-like flavor melds into mouth-puckering resinous pine Forrest. So good and so fresh.
Hazy amber color with a medium, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Pine, citrus, dank, floral, grass, and grapefruit.

Dank piney resinous aroma with some tropical citrus. Taste is a full flavored IPA with primarily dank piney resinous hops but some tropical. Balanced and flavorful and feels very fresh. Solid beer. But more on the piney resinous side, but still nice.
The aroma is stunning. The unfiltered is odd as there is just stuff floating around, but dont care bc its tasty. Pretty amazing as a wet hop in late spring. Great to see Lag is still abusing hops.

Nearly clear amber color with a white head and some floaties. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, resin, caramel. Medium bodied, moderate bitterness, resin flavor dominates with lesser fruit notes. How is this not an IPA?

On tap @ Chucks 85th. Pours clear light orange with just a hint of haze. Thin lacy white head. Aroma is bright tangerine and lemon citrus notes, lightly floral on the back. Taste is likewise, though less citrus and a big earthy finish, light lingering bitterness. Not bad. I cant quite place it, but doesnt resemble a typical fresh hop. Lacks the fresh crispness and tends more toward grassy and vegetal. In spite of the abv, clearly not an IPA - malt is really light and lets the hops shine. Ok.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange. The aroma is huge. The palate is juicy and wet. The taste is big hops. Grapefruit orange zest. Nice earthy bitter bite at end.
aroma is super floral and citrus. flavors are crisp, hoppy and melon. pours copper with a thick cream head. had out of a can at home. this beer is extremely crushable.
Doughy and dank yeast aromas with lots of grapefruit and guava. Moderate bitterness and malt sweetness. Medium body with an abrupt finish. Very good.

Shared 12 oz. bottle poured to snifters showing a cloudy orange color, with a presentable layer of soft white foam, and spots & strands of lacing. The nose was dank, tropical notes as passion fruit & guava, some ripeness, and hints of grass & greenery. Medium bodied, with okay carbonation, the taste was similar, offering complementary booze, and bitterness that retained some of the dank & resinous nature, along with a dose of earthiness. Decent, hoppy Pale. Who would have thought otherwise?

Pours hazy dark straw into a shaker. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving spot lacing. Mango and passionfruit aromas. Dry with sweet yeast, mango, pineapple and passionfruit upfront turning to gritty pith in the lasting finish.

12oz bottle shared by Chalumeaux. Thanks, TJ! Pours cloudy light orange gold with an off white head. Aroma is big Mosaic hop, mango all day long. Flavor is light, with grassy bitterness and mango tropical fruit. Decent.

Poured from bottle hazy yellow with a nice white head. Aromas of juicy citrus pineapple floral notes grass and resinous pine. Taste is mildly sweet notes of citrus grapefruit grass and a nice pine bitterness. Wow.

12 oz. bottle shared by Chalumeaux! Color is hazy gold, lots of carbonation. Aroma is light grapefruit, mild grassy, (almost mosaic like), citrus.

Flavors is a reflection of the aroma. Citrus, juicy grapefruit, mild grass. Body is light and clean with a crispness. And in a blind taste test, I would NEVER have guessed Lagunitas brewed this.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes
Aroma: resin, bread, grass, floral, pine, citrus, 
Appearance: hazy orange-gold with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter finish
Tasty

12 oz bottle. No date but the dude at the store said it just came out. Hazy yellow. Aroma is dank, pine, hop resin. Taste is very bitter. Fresh green hops, lots of resin. Tasty, lagunitas probably does IPAs the best for the national distro.

Pours cloudy orange-golden with a quickly dissipating white foam thats a bit sticky. Aroma is strong resin and pine pitch. Flavor is delicious with the same notes from the nose joining a slightly sweet malt backbone breadiness and smooth as can be. Great mouth-feel, clean pleasant finish. Another solid tasty offering from these guys, they certainly understand pale ales.
12 ounce bottle. Pours with light body and all hops in the nose and body. Grapefruit. No malt. Just like I like it.

Pale yellow pour with white head. Aroma is tropical fruit and sweet malt. Flavor is semi sweet start. Then a hint of fruit and then the boom if grapefruit. Light/medium body with solid bitter finish. Crisp and clean. I like

Draft at Cappys from notes. Pours a hazy dark golden/amber color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have dank, catty and citrusy hop character, pale malts, light caramel, grass, resiny mid palate, nice pale ale.

4 oz draft taster glass at Harrys Tavern (attached to Lukas Liquor) in Martin City, Missouri. The pour is a clear golden orange with a well formed white head. The aroma is dank resin hop, floral, grass all super fresh. The taste is perfume floral, resin herbal grass catty finish. The palate is medium bodied with active natural carbonation and a lingering resin dank finish. Bright fresh beer.
SIBF 2016, Seattle. Creamy white head. Pale cloudy yellow. Dank fresh hop. Pale bitter. Clean solid hoppy pale, ok bitter.

draft at Pour house, pours a murky but bright orange golden shade with medium white head and beautiful lacing. Smell and flavor of kiwi, Guava, mango, light cheese, grass and other severely dank herbals. Juicy, refreshing and crushable at the percentage. Medium bodied. One of the better hoppy beers I have had in the last month or two.
Hazy as hell. Dank oniony garlic with pine and some fruitiness. Flavor is more bitter onion, pine, and tropical fruit.

Hazy golden under a thin rocky white cap, giving a very lovely and pleasant aroma of fresh green leafy farm-wet hops, a touch of piney bitterness and a leafy resin. Crisp and delightful flavor thats wet and leafy and bitter and dark fresh and lightly piney and American-bitter juicy witha little pithy resiny bitterness. Very complex and surprisingly bitter while retaining that lovely wet hop tone throughout.

On tap at Friendship Brewing. It poured a cloudy golden color with a white head. The aroma was of pine, tropical fruits and minor hops. The taste was similar to the aroma with more citrus, tropical fruits, hops and malts. It had some bitterness and a nice clean finish. Looked like a glass of orange juice but was really nice. Tasty.

I had this at Flying Saucer. Pours orangish gold with a white head. Taste citrus, pineapple, oranges. I thought was pretty good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap: Looks murky yellow. This has got to be the fruitiest beer Ive ever had. Intense mango and pineapple smell. Tastes like peach fruit flesh, almost mouth coating, yet the bitterness is fairly mild. Totally delicious.
This one was really delicous. Has a very tropical flavor to it. I liked it quite a bit.
Better than born again today but not quite as good as born tomorrow could be if it was achievable. Well have to settle. Some citrus and some pine and pepper. Good head and lacing.
Draft at Snallygaster 2016. Poured a golden yellow color with a fluffy white head. Aroma was hoppy, tropical fruit notes. Best beer by them since Sucks. Delicious.
6 oz pour on draft at Snallygaster 2016. Hazy orange yellow with off-white head. Aromas and tastes of citrus, floral, pine, tropical fruit. Medium body with a dry finish.
Orange draft pour at the taproom. White head. Tropical peach orange and tangerine flavors. Delicious

Snallygaster. Small beige head atop murky apple cider body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit rind, some juicy grapefruit. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some orange. Light-medium body, light acidity, resin.

Clear deep yellow color with a nice white head and lacing. Nice big hoppy nose - citrus and pine. Big hop flavor too, with a good bitterness in the finish. Super citrusy. Curious how they are preserving their hops.

I dont usually rate beers produced by big-batch brewers. But this beer is an aromatic revelation. Taking a page from small batch producers like Cellarmaker, this beer is hazy in the extreme. The marcom for the beer indicates that the beer uses cryogenically-frozen unkilned hops. But the technical people there said they are doing something a little more complicated in a recent post on BeerAdvocate: "Greetings from Lagunitas....the hops are not cryogenically frozen, its a bit more complicated than that...This is an experimental release at 6 months to validate our new process for keeping wet hops fresh. If we get it right well be able to have a year-round wet hop beer...I think its going to work. Weve been screwing around with it for almost three years now. I hope you like it.....cheers. DogTown, May 27, 2016" When it comes to hop technology, be it hop breeding or hop processing, the West Coast seems to be leading the way. Woohoo!

Nose of dank citrus bread light toast. Pours hazy murk juice juicy shoot loads murky haze #juice with a white head great lace. Soft malt base bread a touch of white sugar danky hops some citrus white grape. Floral dry finish. Hides 7.5% well. Good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On Tap at Growler Guys Meridian, ID Hazy deep orange with a thin soapy off white had. Big fresh hoppy flavors. Modest bitterness. Slightly carmelized maltiness.

Draft sample at Logans Alley - pours a medium gold with thin bright white head . Super citrusy hop aroma . Fresh citrus hop flavors , not overly bitter . Solid . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at growler guys meridian. Pours out a hazy gold topped with white head. Nose is big dank hops melon tropical fruit and a nice malt. Taste is more of the big hop hit plenty dank hops fruit and a nice caramel malty sweetness.
Tap at Logans. Golden with one finger head. Light to medium body. Strong citrus and onion. Light pine. Sometimes Im okay with the oniony IPAs, but this is just eh.

Tap at acadia with commonmac. Bulbous goblet. Really nice yellow hazy with small white head. Nice fresh floral hop nose. Sweet and spicy and citrus in taste, felt almost like a northeast ipa. Effervescent and fresh. Maybe too tangy and sour. Ill still let Him into my life for this one.

Tap at Acadia with commonshawn in a large snifter glass. Definitely picking up the unfiltered nature in its appearance. Citrus golden with a juice like visual. Healthy, but quick to disappear head. Bright aroma with heavy pine and a citrus grapefruit and almost lemon. Taste has plenty of hoppy pine notes with a little soapy tendency. Paired well with a citrus rind characteristic that gives just enough sweetness to avoid being overbearing on the hop bitterness front. Mouthfeel leans towards the cloying side of the equation but not overwhelmingly so. And the Lord said you got to rise up and welcome this beer as your wet hopped savior.
Pours a slightly cloudy golden with a quickly fading white head. Mango and, to a lesser degree, onion on the nose. The onion gets expressed more in the flavor. Astringent on the palate. Fun pale ale.
Poured a lightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma was of juicy and dank hops. Flavor similar, medium bitterness, tasty.

Draught at Toronado. Hazy amber color, white head. Bitter taste with grapefruit, hops, mango, pine, a bit of resin and grass. Bitter finish with grapefruit, hops, mango, resin, pibe and a bit of grass. Excellent APA.

Dank hoppy deliciousness with slightly bitter finish. Appearance is clear yellow. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft to taster at cappys pour avg gold with thin white head. Nose big resin, grass, cat pee, some underlying tropical fruit. Taste moderate bitter bite up front, tropical fruit hop, sweeter malt, grassy. Mid palate light bitterness lasting through the finish. Nice nose and good flavoring hop.
Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Grapefruit and light tart aroma. Grapefruit flavor. Medium bodied. Grapefruit and pine linger with light tartness.

Tap at The Oak. Aroma is so juicy. Pineapple, pine, peaches, pears, dank grass, and flowers. Tastes like dank, juicy hops with a nice cracker malt base. Moderate bitterness is nice too. Pineapple and bitterness linger long after. Love this.

Tap @ Beer Temple, sample size. Clear golden yellow color. Firm, dens white head with good retention and lacing. Aromas: leafy hops, tealeaves, herbal. Retronasal its citrus, herbal hops, some bitterness. Flavor is moderate to full bitter with a touch of malt. Medium bodied. Finishes dry, herbal hoppy, firm bitter

On tap, yellow golden pour with thick creamy white head, smells very fresh, some citrus more lemon than anything else, I can smell some alcohol too, medium texture, fresh and refreshing, juicy, light bread malt backbone, nice balance, tasty

Not quite the match of Born Yesterday, but then again, I didnt get to this one quite as fresh as last time either. Less dank, more fruity hops and a little less explosively aromatic. Still quite good and something I hope they make again.

On draft at Caps & Taps. It pours a clear light golden color with a white head. The aroma is juicy with some peach and a little earthy hop. Hints of honey. The flavor is dank with berries and earthy Mosaic-like hops. Not as juicy as the regular version of Born Yesterday I think. Same oily mouthfeel. I like the hops in this one.

Tap at Capitol Beer in Sacramento, CA. Pours gold with a white head. Aroma is herb/floral - yet it suggests dankness. Med body. Flavor is herb/floral and its dankish - but no citrus or pine? Trying hard I think some of the herb is citrus. Getting a bit of pale stone fruit. Dry and towards dankish. Bitter enough to please. I like it.
On tap at Capitol Beer & Ta Room. Pours golden with a modest off-white head and a citrus and toffee aroma. There is a bitter pale malt flavor with a dank from nish.

Draft to pint at The Pint Room. Looks good; a transparent darker honey gold with foamy white head. Smells and tastes of of citrus zest and piney hops with a big bittersweet backbone. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and pleasantly bitter. Enjoyable.

On tap @ Aces & Ales. Poured a dark golden color with a nice head and bit of lacing. Aroma of pine, tropical fruit and quite herbal. Taste of citrus, tropical fruit and subtle malt sweetness. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Moderate body, crisp clean and very refreshing. Cant beat a fresh brewed limited release beer. Very satisfying.

Pours a clear golden orange on tap with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma of big resinous citrus and tropical hop notes over a hint of bread. Taste is more of the same, a bit toward the standard lagunitas flavor, but fresh as fuck. Solid.

Tap. Poured a clear copper color with an average to large frothy white head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy complex hop aroma. Medium to abundant body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. Very good beer.

From the source on tap. Excellent. Color of honey, sudsy white head. Piney hop aroma, tart fruit notes. Big on the tongue yet easy to drink. Medium bodied, a bit slick, spruce, a malty backbone though.

Rated on 6-11-2016 at The Berg Ale Haus, Huntington, IN. This draft beers appearance is a small head that is fully lasting, golden yellow transparent body, very little visible carbonation observed, and one ring of lacing. The aroma is very aromatic, herbal, grassy, citrus hops, grapefruit, earthy, and fruity. The flavor is moderately bitter, sweet, citrus shops, and fruity. The mouthfeel is very carbonated and this beer is light bodied. Overall, there is something about the taste of this beer that just did not set well with my sense of taste. All I can say is that it is very weird tasting for this beers style. Next!!

Tap. Pours hazy golden, medium off white head, creamy, nice lacing. Aroma is loads of grapefruit, passion fruit, mango, flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, hints of pot. Light plus body, oily mouthfeel. Nice.

This draft brew from a beer bar poured a head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a typically carbonated transparent orange colored body and a fair lacing. The weak aroma was hoppy and musty. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a lingering hoppy aftertaste. The tangy flavor contained notes of mild citrus mild nut mild caramel crisp and hops. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.
